messages: 5a8696750c8af1db9fb9dacc7fd6f7ea (02:37): Hmmm... anybody ever get SSL replication set up properly in 4.1.20?
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (02:54): ERROR 1130 (HY000): Host 'localhost' is not allowed to connect to this MySQL ser
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (02:54): how do I fix this?
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (02:54): this is after an upgrade from mysql 4.x to 5.x
0f62e4992db9757917cbb77bc704ae00 (02:55): hello, with what command can i become the number of current connections to the mysql daemon and the mysql tables ?
eea04b9a0425f9678ed6886f0344ec11 (02:59): man SHOW FULL PROCESSLIST
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:00): devicenull, is it 4.0 -> 5.0? or 4.1-> 5.0? were you able to run "mysql_upgrade" http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/upgrading-from-4-1.html?
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:01): er no I wasnt
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:01): I may be able to start the 4.x server back up
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:01): but it's not cooperating
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:02): devicenull, I had some issue in my upgrade from 4.1 to 5.0. My fix was to replace the mysql database with that from a brand new install of 5.0.
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:03): thats not exactly an option
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:03): this is basically a production server
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:04): devicenull, why not? the "mysql" database is mainly for users and you may add the users back in.
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:04): oh, I thought you meant the entire thing
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:04): I can run the conversion from 4.x to 5.x from the 4 server now
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:05): devicenull, not the whole databases, but just the "mysql" directory inside of datadir.
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:05): I realize this now
5a8696750c8af1db9fb9dacc7fd6f7ea (03:06): Anyone managed to get SSL replication set up?
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:07): this would help if I knew the root password, hrm

87701bac51de0a4e0b31754b81ced06f (03:11): hey I don't have a backup to my mysql and the system won't boot to the primary OS.  IS there a way to pull the database off the harddrive if I boot to Knoppix?
f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (03:11): UT|Work: Just snag the data directory
87701bac51de0a4e0b31754b81ced06f (03:11): under mysql?
87701bac51de0a4e0b31754b81ced06f (03:11): that's it?
87701bac51de0a4e0b31754b81ced06f (03:12): thanks

f6b127e38214e484df709cbee84fa242 (03:12): It'll usually be /var/lib/mysql or /var/db/mysql, and then you can use that to get your MySQL server running again. Also might snag your /etc/my.cnf if it's got anything in it
87701bac51de0a4e0b31754b81ced06f (03:12): great, thanks.
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:16): is there a way to dump the users table so I can reimport it?

814dee798f2d5f787951525acceec344 (03:20): I have a table where the primary key is defined at the end with PRIMARY KEY (`column`) rather than in the column definition. How can I change it so that the column definition says PRIMARY KEY? I tried 'alter table threads change threadid threadid INT UNSIGNED NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY;' (which is already defined as primary key) but it gives me an error saying "Multiple primary key defined"
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:27): devicenull, if you want to get the grant statements, try this http://forums.mysql.com/read.php?28,103285,103285
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:28): devicenull, if only needing the passwords, then just get "select user, host, password from mysql.user".
1a701b37d6371eba0d57122a3ae944f4 (03:28): I decided it was easier to trash it
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:29): devicenull, ok. that was what I did, too. ;-)

81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:38): macgeek, I don't think you could force the "primary key" to appear right next to the column name. the server would rearrange it anyway. you could see it doing that by creating a test table.
814dee798f2d5f787951525acceec344 (03:38): htlmac: okay thanks
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:43): jaypipes, how much longer do we need to wait until upgrading your blog software?
eea04b9a0425f9678ed6886f0344ec11 (03:46): htlmac: :) sucks, don't it.  maybe I will have time this long weekend!
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:50): jaypipes, ok. we can wait. is mysqlcamp open for registration yet for regular goers (not presenters)? I am not seeing a link for reg.
eea04b9a0425f9678ed6886f0344ec11 (03:50): htlmac: sure, it's open. Just go to http://mysqlcamp.org/Participants and put your name down.
eea04b9a0425f9678ed6886f0344ec11 (03:51): htlmac: I will be emailing people information about registration as we get nearer to the event.
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (03:51): jaypipes, ok, thanks. I thought that page were for presenters.
3925aa40a86a0fc6caabc3c775aab26c (03:51): How do I allow outside connections with MySQL5 on WinXP
eea04b9a0425f9678ed6886f0344ec11 (03:51): htlmac: nope, it's for everyone.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (03:52): DrewZF: It's really no different, except where your local firewall come into play.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (03:53): DrewZF: Sorry. No different than say linux.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (03:53): DrewZF: Bind to the proper interface(s), don't skip networking, provide the proper grants.
3925aa40a86a0fc6caabc3c775aab26c (03:59): Xgc: Thanks. Got it working.
d923d906582234f7da470514434fab8b (03:59): DrewZF: No problem.

a4f67fa1100b583d994f9cef7bcd10b9 (04:10): i just used mysqldump --all-databases > all_databases ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a and transfered the  ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a file to the other server and tried mysql < all_databases ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a and i used password where appropriate... and it didn't work... can anyone tell me what i am doing wrong?
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (04:12): MetaPhaze, any error messages? or, anything in your error log?
a4f67fa1100b583d994f9cef7bcd10b9 (04:12): ok now that i look at the  ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a file i see that it is just telling me i didn't use the command right
a4f67fa1100b583d994f9cef7bcd10b9 (04:12): apearently i need another option?
5a8696750c8af1db9fb9dacc7fd6f7ea (04:14): Anyone managed to get SSL replication set up?

81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (04:14): MetaPhaze, you would need "-u" and "-p" as in "mysqldump -u root -p < all_databases ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a". If the source is rather active, you might need "--lock-all-tables" as well.
2a0be8d62ca9580cd38315202869a51a (04:16): MetaPhaze: you might want to use mysqlhotcopy instead
a4f67fa1100b583d994f9cef7bcd10b9 (04:17): htlmac, thanks it worked... now to see if i can get it to go in on the server
a4f67fa1100b583d994f9cef7bcd10b9 (04:17): dkr, if it doesn't work i will give it a shot
44a630f784b8b33e58bee9f2346496cc (04:20): hello. is mysql 4.0.x using subselects?
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (04:22): lordlamer, nope. subqueries are introduced in 4.1.
44a630f784b8b33e58bee9f2346496cc (04:22): and subquerys work there in insert statements?
81db21118163cdf085f0a0034d2b2672 (04:24): !m lordlamer insert select
ac5c74b64b4b8352ef2f181affb5ac2a (04:24): lordlamer: (INSERT ... SELECT Syntax) : http://dev.mysql.com/doc/mysql/en/insert-select.html
44a630f784b8b33e58bee9f2346496cc (04:25): something like that here: insert into table (myid) values ((select id from othertable where xyz));
